title: Denmark approves EUR 1bn financing for H2 pipeline to Germany
subtitle: (Montel) A majority of parties in the Danish parliament have agreed to provide around EUR 1bn in financing for a new 0.5 GW hydrogen pipeline from Denmark to Germany, the country’s energy and climate ministry said late on Thursday.
body:
They aim was to complete the project by 2030, as the first step in developing an infrastructure for hydrogen that could help with the region’s energy transition, the ministry added in a statement, though a final investment decision was yet to be made.
“We need to get the ball rolling on hydrogen, which will require more help. At the moment, market forces can’t do it alone,” energy minister Lars Aagaard said in a statement.
The pipeline would ensure Denmark became a large supplier of green hydrogen to industrial customers in Germany, he added.
